comments:
I had an established connection with my picl engine and my windows GUI. Some 
function breakpoints were set on this engine.  I then tried to connect to the 
same GUI with gdb.  I got the error below and the connection did not complete 
when the engine tried to add the breakpoints.  I tried a couple of times with 
the same result. I then removed all the breakpoints and tried again and it was 
successful.

I have checked the engine FCT bits using an EPDC trace.  It says that function 
breakpoints are supported. You could turn this off temporarily if you don't 
plan 
to support this for the beta.

    9 dbg[1]: GdbPicl: Sending EPDC reply cmd=com.ibm.debug.gdb.commands.CmdPrep
arePgm@35f53a
  159 evt[1]: GdbPicl: EPDC_CMD> Location breakpoint

   15 dbg[1]: GdbPicl: Executing command cmd=com.ibm.debug.gdb.commands.CmdBreak
pointLocation@326af3
ERR[1]: GdbPicl: ######### UNIMPLEMENTED CmdBreakpointLocation.execute **FORCING
** deferred=false;
ERR[1]: GdbPicl: ######## HACK: CmdBreakpointLocation.execute mapping WindowsNam
e=testcpp.obj -> LinuxName=testcpp.c

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -2 < 0
        at java.util.Vector.elementAt(Vector.java:427)
        at com.ibm.debug.gdb.ModuleManager.getPartIDs(ModuleManager.java:239)
        at com.ibm.debug.gdb.commands.CmdBreakpointLocation.execute(CmdBreakpoin
tLocation.java:111)
        at com.ibm.debug.gdb.CommandProcessor.run(CommandProcessor.java:81)


------- Additional Comments From Samantha 2001-11-19 12:16 -------

I have turned off the FCT bit.
Function breakpoint will be supported after beta.
I am leaving his bug as opened as a reminder.
This applies to old CDT, closing as part of cleanup.
